alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 2:41AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Shawnee, northeastern Wabaunsee, southeastern Pottawatomie and southwestern Jackson Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 241 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Marys, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rossville, St. Marys, Maple Hill, Delia and Willard. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 342 and 348. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
